relation: RSF Social Finance (RSF): Social Investment Fund**
FORGE (Financing Ozarks Rural Growth and Economy)
The Cooperative Fund of New England
Conservation Fund: Natural Capital Investment Fund

Offers the everyday investor a secure vehicle for financing social enterprises while earning returns similar to those of a bank CD (Nationwide) http://rsfsocialfinance.org/services/investing/overview/
A hybrid CD/investment where you can tell the bank to put your savings to work directly for small farmers, Fair Trade, and worker and farmer co-ops. http://www.equalexchange.coop/eecd
Makes low-interest loans for community development, education or agricultural projects (Nationwide) http://equitytrust.org/for-lenders
Provides loans to sustain the rural communities in the Ozarks and preserve the Ozark environment of Northwest Arkansas http://forgeonline.com/investors.htm
Helps Maine farmers by providing loans for working capital or farm equipment Learn more at the MOFGA website
Partners with socially responsible investors who seek a modest financial return to deliver a significant community impact in Montana http://www.mtcdc.org/howtoinvest.html

Helps Mid-Western farmers (Iowa, Kansas, Nebraska, Minnesota, N. Dakota, Wisconsin) committed to organic and sustainable agriculture start, maintain and grow their operations by linking them with socially motivated investors This e-mail address is being protected from spambots. You need JavaScript enabled to view it
Collaborates with private investors, lenders and farm support organizations to meet needs of small and mid-sized farms in the Northeast region http://www.thecarrotproject.org/for_investors
35 years investing in New England's food systems, supporting cooperatives, worker ownership, and community nonprofits without one investor losing a penny http://cooperativefund.org/

Builds wealth and opportunity for low-income communities in the Mid Atlantic region (Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland and Washington, DC) through the promotion of socially and environmentally responsible development http://www.trfund.com/invest/how-to-invest/
Provides debt and equity financing to small businesses in West Virginia, Virginia, North Carolina, and Tennessee http://www.ncifund.org/
textBeforeTable: Funds for everyone: Socially responsible and sustainable investing directly in individual small food enterprises near where we live is the goal. There are many steps along the way. To get you started, here are examples of professionally managed funds that are generally consistent with the direction of Slow Money and are available to individual investors today.   Other Ways to Invest Sign-up for updates Slow Money
textAfterTable: Funds for Accredited Investors: Organization Name Eligibility Minimum Investment Minimum Term Description RSF Social Finance (RSF): PRI Funds** Accredited investors $100,000 5 years Offers a streamlined means of recycling program payouts through low-interest loans to fully charitable projects (Nationwide) http://rsfsocialfinance.org/services/investing/overview/ Trillium's Community Investment Portfolio** Accredited investors $25,000 (with $2 million Trillium client minimum) None Invests directly in community development institutions to assist under-served communities.
